snippet: Lawmakers approved a package of harsh austerity measures and economic policy changes that were required by its creditors as the terms of a $94 billion bailout package.
abstract: Greek Parliament approves new austerity measures in order to secure new International Monetary Fund bailout package, with much of support coming from opposition parties; Prime Min Alexis Tsipras unexpectedly takes floor to make case for austerity measures, saying that measures were necessary to avert humanitarian and fiscal disaster; 32 members of Tsipras's Syriza party vote against measures.

byline.original: By SUZANNE DALEY and JAMES KANTER
byline.contributor: Suzanne Daley reported from Athens, and James Kanter from Brussels. Jack Ewing contributed reporting from Frankfurt, and Dimitris Bounias from Athens.

lead_paragraph: Lawmakers approved a package of harsh austerity measures and economic policy changes that were required by its creditors as the terms of a $94 billion bailout package.

headline.main: Greece, Its Back to the Wall, Adopts Austerity Steps
headline.print_headline: Back to Wall, Greece Adopts Austerity Steps
